creator: Ham, George Henry, 1847-1926. (author)
description: Ham, George Henry: 1847-1926. Arrived in Winnipeg, 1875; on staff of Free Press, 1875-1879; founder of ephemeral Tribune, 1879; editor of Winnipeg Times, 1880-1882; registrar for the county of Selkirk for some years after 1882; reporter for Toronto Mail during Saskatchewan Rebellion, 1885; advertising manager for CPR stationed in Montreal, 1891-1926 (Robertson, A political manual of the province of Manitoba; Winshop, The story of the press). // A heavily illustrated directory of places of business in the larger towns along the CPR. Pages [206-220] are advertising. // Digitization of this title was sponsored by the Board of Governors of the University of Alberta to commemorate the service of Mr. Marc de La Bruyère, Member of the Board, 2006-2012
format: [8], [9]-205, [206-220] p., ports., plates (part. fold.), fold. maps.; 26.5 cm.
